page.title: 06INGLESBATCH(INGLESCOMBE)
page.content: Inglesbatch is a small hamlet in the parish of Englishcombe about two miles outside the Bath city boundary. The hamlet is dominated by the two farms: Homefarm and Inglesbatch farm. The remainder of the houses are either owner occupied or tied houses belonging to the farms; about sixteen in total. Inglesbatch Farm house is the largest house in the area and was the former Manor house. Part of this house is four to five hundred years old. In a nearby field Roman platforms have been found. All the houses are of stone construction under slate or tiled roofs. The two farms employ about half the working population. The remainder travel into the city of Bath. Large areas of the surrounding land is owned by the Duchy of Cornwall
